result.execSummary:
The defendant Joel J Succo was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Must report to Probation by today.

miscConds.notes: $265.60 fine/cost to be paid to COCC within 60 days or set up payment plan.  Failure to pay will be a judgment.
$200.00 DNA surcharge to the COCC within 60 days or set up payment plan.  Failure to pay will be a judgment.
Not to have abusive contact with: Mr. Tougas.

Must provide DNA sample.  Defendant may request expungement of the DNA sample under Wis. Stat. 165.77(4) by petitioning the Wisconsin Department of Justice. Expungement of DNA is NOT a court process. 
For information see: http://www.doj.state.wi.us/dles/crime-labs/clb-forms.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Joel J Succo
